data.prayer: Lord, raise up apostolic workers to plant churches in every town in the state of Satupa'itea.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Satupa‘itea, Samoa
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: the state of Satupa'itea has (about) 334 people who know Jesus, 1,397 people who know about him culturally, and 69 people who are far from Jesus.
Lord, the the state of Satupa'itea will disappear one day, but your Word will never disappear. Call all who claim Christianity to anchor their lives on your Word.
data.verse: Heaven and earth will disappear, but my words will never disappear.

data.prayer: Spirit, give the believers of the the state of Satupa'itea unity and humility as they work to bring the kingdom to new people and places.

data.focus_label: Pray for the city of Sagone
data.prayer: Pray that God raises up new churches in the city of Sagone, Satupa‘itea, Samoa.
Father, we cry out for a prayer movement in the state of Satupa‘itea, Samoa. Please, stir the 334 believers here to pray for awakening.
Father, help the 334 believers in Satupa'itea to know your commands and to do them.
data.verse: For Ezra had devoted himself to the study and observance of the Law of the Lord, and to teaching its decrees and laws in Israel.

data.section_summary:
the state of Satupa‘itea, Samoa has a population of 1,800.

We estimate Satupa'itea has 334 people who might know Jesus, 1,397 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 69 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 5 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Father, you have chosen the weak things of this world to confound the strong. Make the poor and outcast in the state of Satupa'itea a testimony of your strength.
data.verse: God chose the foolish things of the world that he might put to shame those who are wise. God chose the weak things of the world, that he might put to shame the things that are strong;
